Korean: 섭씨는 오늘 밤에 친구들과 술을 마실 거예요.
English: Mr. Seop is going to drink with his friends tonight.

Korean: 저는 종교에 대해 많이 알고 있습니다.
English: I know a lot about religion.

Korean: 사업을 하기 위해 열심히 노력하고 있습니다.
English: I am working hard to do business.
I put rice in the rice bowl.
Before we knew it, autumn has arrived.
I'm running all the way here.

Korean: 이 문제점은 어떻게 해결할 수 있을까요?
English: How can we solve this problem?
It looks like I have a cold.
I would like to cancel my reservation.
My nails are too long, so I need to trim them.
I am borrowing from my friend.

Korean: 우리는 이 두 가지 옵션을 비교하여 어떤 것이 더 좋은지 판단해야 한다.
English: We need to compare these two options and decide which one is better.
I recommend my friend to study.

Korean: 수년 동안 우리는 같이 여행을 갔어요.
English: We have traveled together for many years.
I have to go to the bookstore to buy a book.

Korean: 노동자들은 고용 기회를 갖기 위해 노력하고 있습니다.
English: The workers are striving for employment opportunities.
I went to the national museum.
Where is the road to go by sedan?
She tried to escape from the pain.

Korean: 우리는 이번 주에 계획을 정해지기로 했어요.
English: We decided to settle on a plan this week.
The sand is being blown away by the wind on the beach.
I have to go no matter what.
I would like to apply for this course.
Various flowers bloom in all four seasons.
Yesterday night I drank with my friends.
Thank you for leading us, Lord Buddha.

Korean: 우리 지역의 날씨가 어떻게 되고 있는지 알고 싶어요.
English: I want to know how the weather is in our area.
It feels like the day is passing by quickly.
I take a walk in the garden.
I'm curious to know what the viewers think.
What is the reason for that?
I found a book in the drawer.

Korean: 연말에는 친구들과 함께 여행을 가고 싶어요.
English: I want to go on a trip with my friends at the end of the year.

Korean: 고객들이 만족할 만한 서비스를 제공하기 위해 노력하겠습니다.
English: We will strive to provide a service that customers can be satisfied with.
I have decided to be admitted to the hospital.
I worked hard all day today.
I ate sushi for dinner tonight.
There are stripes on that shirt.
